result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon J Clark

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 1:16 p.m. 
INCLUDES: 22CF1283, 22TR2708, 22TR2709;
Defendant appears via Zoom from MCJ, pro se;
Date and time set for a review hearing.

COURT notes SPD is still looking, questions Deft re: prelim time limits.
Defendant wishes to remove prelim.
COURT finds good cause to toll time limits until next hearing. 

DATES:
Remove prelim.
RH: 11/11/22 @ 1:00 p.m. 

Adjourned: 1:19 p.m.

Review hearing on November 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 7, 2022 at 09:20 am.

Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:20 pm
INCLUDES 22CF1283, 22TR2708, 22TR2709.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Jack Mathie in person.
VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

Advised Right of Counsel.

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY on TR Files

- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
